title: "2.8 Correlated noise"
bibliography: bibliography.bib

$~$
<font size="5">*3. If many of the measurements are from the same individual, the i.i.d noise assumption does not make sense*</font>
$~$
$~$

- This is always the case with longitudinal data
- Measurements corresponding to the same individual are correlated
- Requires *hierarchical* modeling
